roleset.name: aspectual, continuing of a process; aspectual
roleset.note: CONTINUE-V NOTES: Based on survey of initial sentences from big corpus, with comparison to 'keep'. Member of VNcls continue-55.3, sustain-55.6. (from continue.01-v)

roles.note: Arg1 may require concatenation in aspectual usages. (from continue.01-v)

example.name: agent and event
example.text: Investors-1 continue *trace*-1 to pour cash into money funds.
example.arg: *trace* to pour cash into money funds

example.name: event, no agent
example.text: [New loans]-1 continue *-1 to slow; they were $6.6 million in the quarter compared with $361.8 million a year ago.

example.name: arg as noun
example.text: ...if the current yield continues for a year.

example.name: just an agent-thingy
example.text: She became an abortionist accidentally, and continued because ...

example.name: Arg0,1
example.text: The member must request their continuation of coverage in writing within 60 days following change in employment.

example.name: transitive
example.text: A Lorillard spokeswoman continued "This is an old story."

example.name: fronted
example.text: [Kent cigarettes were sold]-1, the company continued *Trace*-1

example.name: inverted
example.text: [What matters is what advertisers will pay]-1, continued *Trace*-1 Newsweek's chairman

example.name: split
example.text: ["What you have to understand," continued John *trace*-1, "is that Philly literally stinks."]-1

example.name: with listener
example.text: John continued to Mary: "you're an idiot."

example.name: weird, attributive usage: (probably impossible)
example.text: "Well that's odd," continued John about the disappearance of his nose.
example.arg: about the disappearance of his nose.
